description: A full medical kit, with bandages, local anesthetics, and rapid healing agents.  Used for healing large amounts of damage.  Disassemble to get its content.

name: melatonin tablet
description: Over-the-counter melatonin supplements, commonly prescribed to treat sleep deprivation and to mitigate its effects.  One tablet a day combined with a good night's sleep will help you recover faster.
Medical grade amphetamine salts mixed with Dextroamphetamine salts, commonly prescribed to treat hyperactive attention deficits.  It suppresses the appetite, and is quite addictive.
A syringe filled with a shot of adrenaline.  It serves as a powerful stimulant when you inject yourself with it.  Asthmatics can use it in an emergency to clear their asthma.
A strong antibacterial medication designed to prevent or stop the spread of infection.  It's the safest way to cure any infections you might have.  One dose lasts twelve hours.
Powerful chemical tablets designed to eliminate fungal infections in living creatures.
Broad spectrum chemical tablets designed to eliminate parasitic infestations in living creatures.  Though designed for use on pets and livestock, it will likely work on humans as well.
Acetylsalicylic acid, a mild anti-inflammatory.  Take to relieve pain and swelling.
Simple cloth bandages.  Used for healing small amounts of damage.

name: makeshift bandage
description: Simple cloth bandages.  Better than nothing.
Simple cloth bandages.  It is white, as real bandages should be.
Simple cloth bandages.  It was boiled to make it more sterile.
A powdered form of chemical antiseptic, this bismuth formic iodide cleans wounds quickly and painlessly.

name: caffeinated chewing gum
description: Sugar-free chewing gum with added caffeine, it's a nice pick-me-up.

name: caffeine pill
description: No-doz brand caffeine pills, maximum strength.  Useful in pulling an all-nighter, one pill is about equivalent to a strong cup of coffee.

name: chewing tobacco
description: Mint flavored chewing tobacco.  While still absolutely terrible for your health, it was once a favorite amongst baseball players, cowboys, and other macho types.
Dilute hydrogen peroxide, for use as an antiseptic and for bleaching hair or textiles.  Foams a little when in contact with organic matter, but otherwise harmless.

name: cigarette
description: A mixture of dried tobacco leaf, pesticides, and chemical additives, rolled into a filtered paper tube.  Stimulates mental acuity and reduces appetite.  Highly addictive and hazardous to health.

name: cigar
description:
Rolled, cured tobacco leaf, addictive and hazardous to health.
A gentleman's vice, cigars set the civil man apart from the savage.

name: chloroform soaked rag
description: A debug item that lets you put NPCs (or yourself) to sleep.
A mild opiate used in the suppression of pain, cough, and other ailments.  While relatively weak for a narcotic, it is still addictive, with a potential for overdose.
Crystalline extract of the coca leaf, or at least, a white powder with some of that in it.  A topical analgesic, it is more commonly used for its stimulatory properties.  Highly addictive.

name: methacola
description: A potent cocktail of amphetamines, caffeine and corn syrup, this stuff puts a spring in your step, a fire in your eye, and a bad case of tachycardia tremors in your somersaulting heart.
A pair of extended wear contacts with soft lenses designed to be discarded after a week of use.  They are a great replacement to wearing glasses and sit comfortably on the surface of the eye.
Fluffy balls of clean white cotton.  Can serve as makeshift bandages in an emergency.
Deprotonated cocaine crystals, incredibly addictive and deleterious to brain chemistry.

use_action.activation_message: You smoke your crack rocks.  Mother would be proud.

description: Daytime cold and flu medication.  Non-drowsy formula.  Will suppress coughing, aching, headaches and runny noses, but you'll still need lots of fluids and rest.
A powerful antiseptic commonly used for contaminated wounds.

name: makeshift antiseptic
description: Makeshift antiseptic made from ethanol.  Can be used to disinfect a wound.
A strong benzodiazepine drug used to treat muscle spasms, anxiety, seizures, and panic attacks.

Concentrated cannabis extract, commonly known as dabs.  This particular style of concentrate in is a thin sheet and shatters like glass at room temperature.  Argueably its one of the better styles of concentrate compared to wax, crumble, or distilate.  Normal cannabis contains around 20%THC, this shatter should be around 55%THC.

use_action.activation_message: You take a dab. Wow that's got some killer terpenes!

description: Concentrated cannabis extract, commonly known as dabs.  This particular style of concentrate has the look and consistency of a yellow waxy substance at room temperature.  Normal cannabis contains around 20%THC, this wax should be around 45%THC.

use_action.activation_message: You take a dab of some wax.  *cough cough* good stuff!
You smoke some bad dabs.  Not a good idea.

description: This is high quality concentrated oil derived from cannabis.  It still has some residual solvents in it so it needs to be purged in a vacuum oven, whipped over a heated surface, or distilled before it is safe to consume.

use_action.activation_message: You smoke some really bad dabs.  Not a good idea.

description: This is low quality concentrated oil derived from cannabis.  It still has some residual solvents in it so it needs to be purged in a vacuum oven, whipped over a heated surface, or distilled before it is safe to consume.
This is low quality concentrated oil derived from cannabis thats been diluted in ethanol and heated over a hotplate.  The next step would be to filter it through a buchner flask.
This is high quality concentrated oil derived from cannabis thats been diluted in ethanol and heated over a hotplate.  The next step would be to filter it through a buchner flask.

This is low quality concentrated oil derived from cannabis thats been diluted in ethanol, heated over a hotplate, and filtered through a buchner flask.  The next step would be to run it through a rotovap.

This is high quality concentrated oil derived from cannabis thats been diluted in ethanol, heated over a hotplate, and filtered through a buchner flask.  The next step would be to run it through a rotovap.

This is low quality concentrated oil derived from cannabis thats been diluted in ethanol, heated over a hotplate, filtered through a buchner flask, and all the ethanol recovered using a rotary evaporator.  It is ready for the distillation.

use_action.activation_message: You smoke some really bad dabs.  Not a good idea.

description: This is high quality concentrated oil derived from cannabis thats been diluted in ethanol, heated over a hotplate, filtered through a buchner flask, and all the ethanol recovered using a rotary evaporator.  It is ready for the distillation.

use_action.activation_message: You smoke some really bad dabs.  Not a good idea.

description: Concentrated cannabis extract.  This is the 'heads' portion from a distilled batch of crude oil.  It still needs to be ran through a lab grade still one more time before its a finished product.
Concentrated cannabis extract.  This material is the 'tails' portion from a distilled batch of crude oil.  It needs to be ran through a lab grade still another time.

Concentrated cannabis extract.  This style of extract goes through the most processing, eliminating most if not all harmful ingredients.  Normal cannabis contains around 20%THC, this distillate should be around 88%THC.  Can be smoked in a bowl, used in a dab pen, or used to make distillate cartridges.

use_action.activation_message: You take a dab of some distillate.  Sooooo smooth...

description: A small cartridge containing concentrated cannabis extract thats used with dab pens.  This style of extract goes through the most processing, eliminating most if not all harmful ingredients.  Normal cannabis contains around 20%THC, this distillate should be around 70%THC after reintroducing terpenes for flavoring.

use_action.activation_message: You hit your dab pen.  Sooooo smooth...

name: electronic cigarette
description: This battery-operated device vaporizes a liquid that contains flavorings and nicotine.  A less harmful alternative to traditional cigarettes, but it's still addictive.  It can't be reused once it's empty.
Sterile saline eye drops.  Can be used to treat dry eyes, or to wash out contaminants.

name: flu shot
description: Pharmaceutical flu shot designed for mass vaccinations, still in the packaging.  Purported to provide immunity to influenza, for the flu season for which it was developed.
Bright pink sugar-free chewing gum.

name: hand-rolled cigarette
description: A roll-your-own made from tobacco and rolling paper.  Stimulates mental acuity and reduces appetite.  Despite being hand crafted, it's still highly addictive and hazardous to health.
//: Tougher to market a hand rolled, could be anything in there.

description: An extremely strong opioid narcotic derived from morphine.  Incredibly addictive, the risk of overdose is extreme, and the drug is contraindicated for nearly all medical purposes.

name: potassium iodide tablet
description: Potassium iodide tablets.  If taken prior to exposure, they help to mitigate injury caused by radiation absorption.

name: joint
description: Marijuana, cannabis, pot.  Whatever you want to call it, it's rolled up in a piece of paper and ready for smokin'.

name: pink tab
description: Tiny pink tabs resembling postage stamps, already dosed with some sort of drug.  Really only useful for entertainment.  Will cause hallucinations.

name: medical gauze
description: This is decent sized piece of cotton, sterilized and sealed.  It's designed for medical purposes.
A profoundly addictive and powerful stimulant.  While extremely effective at enhancing alertness, it is hazardous to health and the risk of an adverse reaction is great.

name: morphine
description: A very strong semi-synthetic narcotic used to treat intense pain in hospital settings.  This injectable drug is very addictive.

name: mugwort oil
description: Some essential oil made from mugwort, which may kill parasites when ingested.  Consume it with water!

name: nicotine gum
description: Mint flavored sugar-free nicotine chewing gum.  For smokers who desire to quit.
Nighttime cold and flu medication.  Useful when trying to sleep with a head full of virions.  Will cause drowsiness.

name: oxycodone
description: A strong semi-synthetic narcotic used in the treatment of intense pain.  Highly addictive.
//: Fairly controlled substance as they go.

description: A habit-forming tranquilizer with a variety of psychoactive side effects.  Used in the treatment of insomnia.  Its generic name is zolpidem tartrate.

name: poppy painkiller
description: Potent opioid palliative produced by the refining of the mutated poppy.  Notably devoid of euphoric or sedative effects, as an opiate it may still be addictive.

name: poppy sleep
description: A potent sleep aid extracted from mutated poppy seeds.  Effective, but as an opiate, it may be addictive.
Cough syrup made from mutated poppy.  Will make you sleepy.

A common and popular antidepressant.  It will elevate mood, and can profoundly affect the action of other drugs.  It is only rarely habit-forming, though adverse reactions are not uncommon.  Its generic name is fluoxetine.
//: Don't have a cite for this one.

description: Tablets containing oxidized ferrous ferrocyanide salts.  Capable of purging nuclear contaminants from the body if taken after radiation exposure.
A powdered antihemorrhagic compound that reacts with blood to immediately form a gel-like substance that stops bleeding.

name: saline solution
description: A solution of sterilized water and salt for intravenous infusion or washing contaminants from one's eyes.
Anti-psychotic medication.  Used to stabilize brain chemistry, it can arrest hallucinations and other symptoms of psychosis.  Carries a sedative effect.  Its generic name is chlorpromazine.

name: thyme oil
description: Some essential oil made from thyme, which can act as a mildly irritating antiseptic.

name: rolling tobacco
description:
Loose, fine-cut tobacco leaves.  Popular in Europe and among hipsters.  Highly addictive and hazardous to health.
Can either be rolled into a cigarette with some rolling papers or smoked through a pipe.

name: tramadol
description: A painkiller used to manage moderate pain.  The effects last for several hours, but are relatively subdued for an opioid.

name: gamma globulin shot
description: This immunoglobulin booster contains concentrated antibodies prepared for intravenous injection to temporarily strengthen the immune system.  It is still in its original packaging.

name: multivitamin
description: Essential dietary nutrients conveniently packaged in pill form.  An option of last resort when a balanced diet is not possible.  Excess use can cause hypervitaminosis.

name: calcium tablet
description: White calcium tablets.  Widely used by elderly people with osteoporosis as a method to supplement calcium before the apocalypse.

name: bone meal tablet
description: Homemade calcium supplement made out of bone meal.  Tastes horrible and is hard to swallow but it does its job.

name: flavored bone meal tablet
description: Homemade calcium supplement made out of bone meal.  Due to some sweetness mixed in to counteract the powdery texture and the taste of ash, it's almost as palatable as the pre-Cataclysm tablets.

name: gummy vitamin
description: Essential dietary nutrients conveniently packaged in a fruit-flavored chewy candy form.  An option of last resort when a balanced diet is not possible.  Excess use can cause hypervitaminosis.

name: injectable vitamin B
description: Small vials of pale yellow liquid containing soluble vitamin B for injection.

name: injectable iron
description: Small vials of dark yellow liquid containing soluble iron for injection.

The dried flower buds and leaves harvested from a psychoactive variety of hemp plant.  Used to reduce nausea, stimulate appetite and elevate mood.  It can be habit-forming, and adverse reactions are possible.

use_action.activation_message: You smoke some weed.  Good stuff, man!

description: Anti-anxiety agent with a powerful sedative effect.  May cause dissociation and loss of memory.  It is dangerously addictive, and withdrawal from regular use should be gradual.  Its generic name is alprazolam.
//: Yeah, kinda guessing at these ones, but generic is cheaper.

description: A rag soaked in antiseptic.  Useful for light wounds, probably won't help with deep bites.
//: Can't copy-from rag, it breaks the stacking for some reason!

description: Fluffy balls of clean white cotton.  Now soaked with antiseptic, they are somewhat useful to disinfect a wound.

A broad-spectrum antibiotic used to suppress infections and prevent them from setting in.  It isn't strong enough to purge infections outright, but it boosts the body's resistance against them.  One dose lasts twelve hours.

name: heartburn medicine
description: Creamy pink heartburn syrup that soothes upset stomachs and quells vomitous urges.

An apple-red gel capsule the size of your thumbnail, filled with a thick oily liquid that shifts from black to purple at unpredictable intervals, flecked with tiny gray dots.  Given the place you got it from, it's either very potent, or highly experimental.  Holding it, all the little aches and pains seem to fade, just for a moment…
Clear jelly harvested from cattail, has antiseptic properties and works as a painkiller.

name: destragon
description: A prescription-strength antibacterial medication designed to prevent or stop the spread of infection.  It contains nearly toxic levels of antibiotics, but can treat any bacterial infections you may encounter.  One dose lasts twelve hours.
